016package com.nickbenn.adventofcode.day07;
017
018import static com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.Presentation.NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT;
019
020import com.nickbenn.adventofcode.view.DataSource;
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.util.Iterator;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Map;
025import java.util.Map.Entry;
026import java.util.function.Function;
027import java.util.function.IntUnaryOperator;
028import java.util.regex.Matcher;
029import java.util.regex.Pattern;
030import java.util.stream.Collectors;
031import java.util.stream.Stream;
032
033/**
034 * Implements solutions for both parts of day 7, reading an input file where each line specifies a
035 * card hands and bid (wager), for subsequent ranking and summing by the {@link #getWinnings()}
036 * method.
037 * <p>After reading the input data, parts 1 and 2 both require the same type of
038 * calculation&mdash;namely, rank the hands in reverse (the hand with the lowest value has a rank
039 * of 1), multiply each rank by the bid for that hand, and sum the result. However, the two parts
040 * differ in the treatment of a Jack (represented by {@code 'J'} in the input file):</p>
041 * <ul>
042 *   <li>In part 1, Jacks are treated as usual, ranking between 10s and Queens.</li>
043 *   <li>In part 2, Jacks are Jokers&mdash;that is, they are wild. Wild Jacks in a hand are always
044 *   added to the largest group (other than Jacks) of cards in the hand.</li>
045 * </ul>
046 *
047 * @see <a href="https://adventofcode.com/2023/day/7">"Day 7: Camel Cards"</a>.
048 */
049public class CamelCards {
050
051  private static final Pattern HAND_BID_EXTRACTOR = Pattern.compile("(\\S+)\\s+(\\d+)");
052
053  private final Map<Hand, Integer> hands;
054
055  /**
056   * Initializes this instance, using the value of {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE} as the name
057   * (relative to the package of this class on the classpath) of the file to be read, with
058   * {@code jackIsWild} specifying whether the Jack card (identified as {@code 'J'} in the input) is
059   * wild. In other words, using this constructor is equivalent to using
060   * {@link #CamelCards(String, boolean) CamelCards(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE, jackIsWild)}.
061   *
062   * @param jackIsWild Specifies whether the Jack card ({@code 'J'}) is wild.
063   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}} cannot be
064   *                     found or read.
065   */
066  public CamelCards(boolean jackIsWild) throws IOException {
067    this(DataSource.DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE, jackIsWild);
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Initializes this instance, using {@code inputFile} as the name (relative to the package of this
072   * class on the classpath) of the file to be read, with {@code jackIsWild} specifying whether the
073   * Jack card (identified as {@code 'J'} in the input) is wild. Each line of {@code inputFile} is
074   * parsed, extracting the five cards of the hand and the bid (wager) for that hand.
075   *
076   * @param jackIsWild Specifies whether the Jack card ({@code 'J'}) is wild.
077   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}} cannot be
078   *                     found or read.
079   */
080  public CamelCards(String inputFile, boolean jackIsWild) throws IOException {
081    try (Stream<String> lines = DataSource.simpleLines(inputFile, this)) {
082      hands = lines
083          .map(HAND_BID_EXTRACTOR::matcher)
084          .filter(Matcher::matches)
085          .collect(Collectors.toMap((matcher) -> new Hand(matcher.group(1), jackIsWild),
086              (matcher) -> Integer.parseInt(matcher.group(2))));
087    }
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * For each of parts 1 and 2, creates an instance of {@link CamelCards}, invokes the
092   * {@link #getWinnings()} solution method, and prints the result.
093   *
094   * @param args Command-line arguments (currently ignored).
095   * @throws IOException If the file referenced by {@link DataSource#DEFAULT_INPUT_FILE}} cannot be
096   *                     found or read.
097   */
098  public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
099    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 1, new CamelCards(false).getWinnings());
100    System.out.printf(NUMERIC_SOLUTION_FORMAT, 2, new CamelCards(true).getWinnings());
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Sorts hands by value, assigns each a reversed rank (1 for the lowest-valued hand, and
105   * ascending), multiplies the rank by the bid for that hand, computes the sum of these products
106   * over all hands, and returns the result.
107   *
108   * @return Sum of (reversed rank X bid) over all hands.
109   */
110  public int getWinnings() {
111    int[] count = {0};
112    return hands
113        .entrySet()
114        .stream()
115        .sorted(Entry.comparingByKey())
116        .mapToInt((entry) -> ++count[0] * entry.getValue())
117        .sum();
118  }
119
120  private static class Hand implements Comparable<Hand> {
121
122    private static final char JACK = 'J';
123    private static final Map<Character, Integer> FACE_CARD_VALUES = Map.ofEntries(
124        Map.entry('T', 10),
125        Map.entry('J', 11),
126        Map.entry('Q', 12),
127        Map.entry('K', 13),
128        Map.entry('A', 14)
129    );
130
131    private final String cards;
132    private final IntUnaryOperator cardEvaluator;
133    private final List<Integer> counts;
134
135    public Hand(String cards, boolean jackIsWild) {
136      this.cards = cards;
137      cardEvaluator = (card) -> cardValue((char) card, jackIsWild);
138      Map<Integer, Long> frequencies = computeFrequencies(cards);
139      counts = compileGroupCounts(frequencies, jackIsWild);
140    }
141
142    @SuppressWarnings("NullableProblems")
143    @Override
144    public int compareTo(Hand other) {
145      int comparison = compareGroups(other);
146      if (comparison == 0) {
147        comparison = compareCards(other);
148      }
149      return comparison;
150    }
151
152    private int compareGroups(Hand other) {
153      Iterator<Integer> thisIterator = counts.iterator();
154      Iterator<Integer> otherIterator = other.counts.iterator();
155      int comparison = 0;
156      while (thisIterator.hasNext() && otherIterator.hasNext() && comparison == 0) {
157        comparison = thisIterator.next() - otherIterator.next();
158      }
159      return comparison;
160    }
161
162    private int compareCards(Hand other) {
163      char[] thisCards = cards.toCharArray();
164      char[] otherCards = other.cards.toCharArray();
165      int comparison = 0;
166      for (int i = 0; i < thisCards.length && comparison == 0; i++) {
167        comparison =
168            cardEvaluator.applyAsInt(thisCards[i]) - cardEvaluator.applyAsInt(otherCards[i]);
169      }
170      return comparison;
171    }
172
173    private static Map<Integer, Long> computeFrequencies(String labels) {
174      return labels
175          .chars()
176          .boxed()
177          .collect(Collectors.groupingBy(Function.identity(), Collectors.counting()));
178    }
179
180    private static List<Integer> compileGroupCounts(
181        Map<Integer, Long> frequencies, boolean jackIsWild) {
182      int wildCount = jackIsWild ? frequencies.getOrDefault((int) JACK, 0L).intValue() : 0;
183      List<Integer> counts = frequencies
184          .entrySet()
185          .stream()
186          .filter((entry) -> !jackIsWild || entry.getKey() != JACK)
187          .sorted(Entry.<Integer, Long>comparingByValue().reversed())
188          .map((entry) -> entry.getValue().intValue())
189          .collect(Collectors.toList());
190      if (wildCount > 0) {
191        if (counts.isEmpty()) {
192          counts.add(wildCount);
193        } else {
194          counts.set(0, counts.get(0) + wildCount);
195        }
196      }
197      return counts;
198    }
199
200    private int cardValue(char card, boolean jackIsWild) {
201      return (!jackIsWild || card != JACK)
202          ? (Character.isDigit(card)
203              ? Character.getNumericValue(card)
204              : FACE_CARD_VALUES.get(card))
205          : 0;
206    }
207
208  }
209
210}
